name: Bettoja Massimo D'Azeglio Hotel

reviews.title: Good value - excellent location
reviews.text: I liked this hotel for it's location. It is right next to Termini, the main train station and the Metro is only a block away. It is within walking distance of the Colloseum. I had a 1 person room, so the bed was small, but the bathroom was fine. All in all, no complaints. Good value and certainly good location

i found this hotel on hotels.com. i have been traveling around europe for a few weeks. for the amount i paid for this hotel i was blown away. the room was large. the bathroom was very big with a full shower/tub, marble everywhere and a bidet.
reviews.title: very happy

reviews.text: the hotel was very clean and kept very well. the front staff was very helpful and personnable.
reviews.title: Trip to Rome w/ Mom
Good hotel, but keep a few things in mind
reviews.text: the location was great. it is on via cavour about 100 meters from tremini station and a 12 minute walk to the coloseum and roman forums. there are also plenty of restaurants around the hotel and shops to pick up souvenires and day to day items.
the hotel furnishes you with breakfast and any items that you may have forgotten in your toiletrie bag.
reviews.title: Nice People, But.....

reviews.text: This hotel was on the "Ten Day Crown of Italy" Tour we went on with Gate 1. I travel a lot for my job in the states and stay at Hyatts, Hiltons, etc. I was pretty much pleased with this hotel. Ask for a large room when you check in and if they have one free, they'll move you (couples...book twin bed rooms in Italy. They are normally pushed together anyway. King and Queen beds are NOT the size we are used to). We had a large lovely room with a beautiful bathroom, refrigerator, flat screen TV and good air conditioning. My 2 kids received the same type of room. Great location for the trains and buses (be adventurous!), a Conad supermarket in the nearby Termini station where we picked up 6 packs of water for 1.5 Euro, bottles of local good wine for 4 Euro, snacks, etc. Breakfast was pretty good. The hotel was clean, service was great.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a four nights visit in Rome.
reviews.title: Practical Base For Exploring Rome

reviews.text: The hotel provided easy access to both metro and busses, whilst it was not lacking in the areas of cleanliness,staff service, room quality and breakfast.
reviews.title: So and so

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would definetely recommended for couples who need a base from whch to explore the city of Rome.
reviews.title: Hotel very nice, room small

reviews.text: Of rather minor importance was the small tremure felt when train cars from near by metro station passed by.
reviews.title: Great for exploring city and traveling around

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for an extended weekend in July 2009. The hotel is not in the historic centre of Rome, but it's extremely close to the train station and a one minute walk to the nearest subway station. While the subway is convenient for the Colosseum and Forum, the Vatican, Spanish Steps, Piazza de Popolo and the Trevi Fountain, it's not convenient for sights in the western areas of central Rome, i.e., around Piazza Navona, the Pantheon, Campo de Fiori, etc. The nearest "big" tourist attraction is the Colosseum and while it might be a comfortable 15 minute walk in the Fall, Winter or Spring, it was no fun at all in the middle of Summer.
reviews.title: Good airconditioning in steaming city

reviews.text: As to the hotel itself, we found it very clean and despite the 170+ rooms, discreet and private. Our room was large by Italian standards, the air conditioning worked briliiantly, the bed was comfortable and the bathroom was a decent size. Our room faced a side street but close to the busy Via Cavour and we never heard any traffic noises, although at times, you can feel the subway rumble underneath....no big deal. We had plenty of cable channels, but only CNN and BBC News in English and one German channel....everything else was in Italian. There is no internet service in the room, but there's a computer in the lobby that you can use for a fee.
reviews.title: Hotel was the best of the four we stayed in on the tour............

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't have dinner at the hotel but breakfast was OK. There were two hot dishes...eggs and bacon, plus cheese, one cold meat, cereal, fruit and bread. The coffee was good and strong.
reviews.title: Very close to the train, but far from the sites...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What really stood out at this hotel was the friendliness of the staff. I did not find Romans to be very friendly and in fact, curt on many occasions. However, the staff at the hotel was very courteous, helpful and attentive.
reviews.title: The Massimo was magic..

likes.liked: — The wonderful sense of space afforded by the high elegant ceiling through out the five stories of the Hotel
likes.disliked: — Hard to say - nothing to moan about !

reviews.text: We got the room through Priceline at $130 a night which I thought was excellent value for a room during Summer in Rome. If you don't mind the subway and walking, I would definitely recommend this hotel for a stay in Rome.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

likes.disliked: — The bed was harder than at usual hotels

reviews.text: Excellent hotel, clean & spacious room. Little trouble with the "Key Cards" didn't always work but staff always on hand to fix. Great location to catch buses & tour buses, just a few minutes walk from Metro & mainline station! Staff helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.text: DON'T USE Terravision to & from the airport! RIP OFF, not reliable. Use a shuttle bus, cheaper & reliable!
reviews.title: Great Hotel
Highly recommended !
reviews.text: Excellent hotel, clean, spacious room. Great location to catch buses and tour buses etc! Staff helpful and friendly.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely place!
reviews.title: Hmm! I Will Never Stay Here Again!

reviews.text: Don’t use Terri vision to and from the airport! Rip off, not reliable. Use a shuttle bus, cheaper and reliable!
reviews.title: Great Location, Noisy room, Watch the elevators

description: Since 1875 the Hotel Massimo d’Azeglio has provided traditional hospitality to its numerous Italian and Foreign guests. Although through the years it has been refurbished many times the hotel has maintained its “turn of the century” character. Its halls, bar and restaurant house an important collection of paintings and prints of the Italian “Risorgimento”. The wood paneled Restaurant, with its famous wine cellar, is one of the best known in the city. The Massimo d’Azeglio Restaurant and Hotel has been included amongst the historic hotels of Italy. The Massimo d'Azeglio Hotel has 185 Rooms,3 Conference Rooms, Garage, Bar & Restaurant, Air Conditioning, TV Satellite, Minibar, Free Wi-Fi.
